oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Photograph of photographers
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Sepia-tone photographic print of three men perched atop Point Lookout. Moccasin Bend is in the background. A stereoview camera is set up on a tripod. The gentleman in front is local photographer Royan M. Linn who established a studio at the point in 1863.; He began taking pictures shortly after Federal forces won the Battle of Lookout Mountain (November 24, 1863), also called the "Battle Above the Clouds."
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Linn, Royan M.
